pages.title: Vitamin B3 can reduce skin cancer development
pages.summary: VA data sheds new light on the effectiveness of nicotinamide, a form of vitamin B3, in reducing skin cancer development.

pages.title: My HealtheVet and Telehealth “make all the difference” for Veteran
pages.summary: Veteran Jim Smith uses VA telehealth to manage his care and maintain his health so he can do his part to support fellow Veterans.

pages.title: Breaking the myth: Understanding Veteran homelessness
pages.summary: Learn how Veteran homelessness takes many forms, how you can help break the stigma around homelessness, and how you can help homeless Veterans access the resources they’ve earned and deserve.

pages.title: Five essential suicide prevention resources
pages.summary: In 2025, VA’s Office of Suicide Prevention shared resources, practical guidance, and insights for Veterans.

pages.title: VA Research Wrap Up: New findings on Veteran mortality, weight loss and heart failure
pages.summary: VA Research recently published three News Briefs highlighting findings on Veteran mortality, weight loss and heart failure.

pages.title: VA Deputy Secretary discusses 2025 accomplishments, 2026 goals on Federal EHR Update
pages.summary: The Honorable VA Deputy Secretary Paul Lawrence, Ph.D., appeared on VA's internal program, the weekly “Federal Electronic Health Record (EHR) Update” on Dec. 9. to discuss VA's 2025 accomplishments and goals for 2026.

pages.title: A different type of service in a new uniform
pages.summary: Veteran Manuel Calo, Jr. won the 2025 Peer Specialist of the Year for the West Palm Beach VA Healthcare System for his exceptional service to Veterans.

pages.title: Mini horse, big mission
pages.summary: Heroes come in all shapes and sizes, and sometimes they arrive as a mini horse.

pages.title: Fisher House helps Veteran recover
pages.summary: The Fisher House at VA Palo Alto health care has long provided a home away from home for families of Veterans receiving medical care.

pages.title: Veteran’s health and confidence restored by VA wellness program
pages.summary: Audrey Barrett’s journey shows how personalized support and wellness helps Veterans embrace a healthier, happier and more empowered life.

pages.title: TSGLI celebrates 20 years of honoring severely injured service members
pages.summary: The Servicemembers’ Group Life Insurance Traumatic Injury Protection (TSGLI) program is celebrating 20 years of providing short-term financial support to help eligible service members recover from traumatic injuries.

pages.title: Year in Review: Federal job application changes
pages.summary: In this edition of the Year in Review, we’re taking another look at 2025’s biggest federal job application changes and what they mean for job seekers.

pages.title: Unseen heroes: Enhancing Veteran care at VA Augusta
pages.summary: Dedicated teams work behind the scenes to improve safety and care quality, much like the agents in "Men in Black," ensuring Veterans receive the best care.

pages.title: How the Veterans Crisis Line prevents Veteran suicide
pages.summary: A clear overview of how Veterans and their supporters can use the Veterans Crisis Line for suicide prevention and ongoing support.

pages.title: LiveWholeHealth #297: Reflections and intentions for 2026
pages.summary: Each December, we often reflect on the year we've lived. As you head into 2026, take a few moments to get quiet and set your intentions for the upcoming year.

pages.title: Pelvic health physical therapy restores quality of life for Veterans
pages.summary: For a group of Veterans, a sensitive but common issue is being addressed, pelvic floor dysfunction. Pelvic health is part of overall wellness but often overlooked.

pages.title: Veteran homelessness isn’t always visible
pages.summary: Veteran homelessness isn’t always visible, and understanding its many forms can help connect those experiencing homelessness with vital VA support.

pages.title: Supporting Veterans through evidence-based harm reduction
pages.summary: By supporting evidence-based life-saving harm reduction services, VA is helping Veterans move towards healthier, more fulfilling lives.

pages.title: Veteran and wounded dog found healing together
pages.summary: A heartwarming story about how one Veteran and his Veteran dog are healing together, learning to heal physical and mental wounds.

pages.title: Army Veteran: Cancer care at VA saved my life
pages.summary: Army Veteran Darryl Lynch found expert cancer care and compassion from the same VA hospital where he served Veterans for nearly 20 years.

pages.title: Airborne hazards: A Veteran toolkit for respiratory health
pages.summary: Explore the Deployment Related Respiratory Disease Toolkit for Veterans on exposure to airborne hazards.

pages.title: Make a difference at a rural VA
pages.summary: Here's a look at Carl Vinson VA, located in rural Dublin, Ga., a small town with a big heart. See if a career serving Veterans here is right for you!

pages.title: Five strategies for surviving the holidays
pages.summary: The holidays can be joyous but also emotionally hard, especially if you’re already experiencing challenges. Learn some ways to navigate the season.

pages.title: Kicking the habit: A smoking cessation success story
pages.summary: Navy Veteran Frederick Hamilton quit tobacco after years, inspired by a VA smoking cessation support group. Now tobacco-free, he feels "like a million bucks."

pages.title: VA Research Wrap Up: New findings on RSV vaccines, heart disease and homelessness
pages.summary: VA Research recently published findings on respiratory syncytial virus vaccines, a potential heart disease treatment, and health care for homeless Veterans.

pages.title: Use your phone for check-in, travel claims
pages.summary: VA offers easy patient check-in and travel reimbursement by phone.

pages.title: How do I know if prostate cancer screening is right for me?
pages.summary: With the help of your VA provider, you can learn whether prostate cancer screening is right for you.

pages.title: The history of addiction treatment at VA: Part 3
pages.summary: Post-Vietnam VHA hospitals introduced new treatments for addiction, addressing the challenges faced by Veterans.

pages.title: How VA’s Mindfulness Coach app helped a Veteran healing and find joy
pages.summary: After loss and injury, an Army Veteran found healing through VA digital health tools, helping him rediscover purpose and strength.

pages.title: From unemployable to Ph.D.
pages.summary: How an Army Veteran rated for Individual Unemployability (IU) took control of his life, and now holds the title Doctor.
